result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas James Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Thomas James Johnson.  Attorney Nate McClure in court for State of Wisconsin.   Dr. Jeffrey Washelewsky appeared by telephone.  Court held colloquy with defendant who informed the court that he does agree with the findings of Dr. Washelewsky that he is unlikely to be restored to competency within the statutory time limits.   Competency hearing proceeded. State and defense have previously stipulated to Dr. Washelewsky's profession qualifications to testify. Sworn for the state:  Dr. Jeffrey Washelewsky.
Arguments heard from state and defense.  Court placed findings on the record and finds with clear and convincing evidence that defendant remains incompetent   Court granted state's motion to convert the case to a Chapter 51 commitment.  Court finds  and REMANDED the defendant.  Conversion Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Thomas James Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a review hearing.  Doctor's report received and filed. State does not contest findings, however Defense contest findings and requests a hearing. Case scheduled for competency hearing, Reserve Branch. Case is passed to contact the Doctor to schedule competency hearing.

Case recalled at 4:06pm.
Court is unable to receive a confirmation from the doctor of a scheduling conflict. Competency hearing is tentatively scheduled.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Thomas James Johnson in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR RESERVE BRANCH 13.  Competency hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. John Pankiewicz.  Parties stipulate to his professional credentials. Testimony proceeded.  Statements heard from state and defense.  
After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Pankiewicz,  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame .  The Court further authorized DHS to administer medications or treatment to the defendant.    Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned  back to Branch 13 for Competency Review Hearing  Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Thomas James Johnson in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report. State does not dispute the findings. Defense counsel advices the Court the defendant is not competent enough to answer. Case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from Dr. Pankiewicz, received and filed.
Signed and Filed, Order for Competency Exam.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Thomas James Johnson not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference.
Defense counsel advises the Court they are in receipt of discovery but no offer. Defense further advises the Court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. 
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

No Contact Order signed and filed.

Defendant Thomas James Johnson in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Thomas James Johnson in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
